poem:
### Unseasoned Scorch

Under the swelter of questions,  
a fragile world quivers—  
unwoven by clouds or  
the dark breath of a volcano.  
  
Steam rises, mist slender as  
faces peering to dawn,  
wondering if the sun,  
like words yet unsaid,  
burns because  
it is reaching.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘This was not normal’: US scientists grapple with a year of record heat Scientists are still puzzling over the reasons behind a streak of unexpected, record heat that scorched 2023 and into this year, sparking fears that the climate crisis could be moving faster than previously thought. Is it the clouds? Or shipping? Or maybe a huge volcanic eruption? A parade of climate researchers presented potential reasons for the apparent surge in global heating at". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
